title: WATCH:  Guinness World Record breaker fits 110 candy canes in his beard
description: Joel Strasser is known as a “serial record-breaker” and has multiple Guinness World Records titles for putting various items in his beard, including chopsticks, golf tees and paper straws.

title: Maxi Jazz, front man for British band Faithless, dead at 65
description: Maxi Jazz, a DJ and singer who fronted the eclectic British dance band Faithless known for such hits as “Insomnia” and “We Come 1,” has died

title: Pope on Christmas: Jesus was poor, so don't be power-hungry
description: In the splendor of St. Peter's Basilica, Pope Francis was presiding over Christmas Eve Mass

title: Water pressure 'fluctuating' in Jackson amid frigid weather
description: Officials in Jackson, Mississippi, say the city’s water system is experiencing “fluctuating” pressure on Saturday afternoon amid frigid temperatures

title: Lake loses suit over her defeat in Arizona governor’s race
description: A judge threw out the Republican's challenge of her defeat.

title: Pelé's family gathers at hospital in Sao Paulo
description: The 82-year-old soccer icon has been at the hospital since the end of November.

title: Federal judge says San Francisco can't clear homeless camps
description: A federal judge has temporarily banned San Francisco from clearing homeless encampments, saying the city is violating its own policies

title: Taliban use water cannon on women protesting university ban
description: Eyewitnesses in the western Afghan city of Herat say Taliban forces used a water cannon to disperse a protest over their university ban for women

title: Tesla stock has plummeted since Elon Musk took over Twitter. Here's why.
description: Shares of Tesla have fallen 45% in two months since Elon Musk acquired Twitter.

title: Truck with liquified gas explodes in South Africa; 8 killed
description: A truck carrying liquified petroleum gas has exploded in the South African town of Boksburg, east of Johannesburg, killing at least 8 people and injuring 50 others on Saturday

title: WATCH:  Watch this military parent's reaction when their son surprises them as their gift
description: Senior Airman Jaylen's parents thought they were getting a Christmas gift sent from him while he was on duty. They had no idea that their son would jump out and surprise them.

title: Hong Kong leader aims to reopen border with China next month
description: Hong Kong’s leader says China has agreed to a reopening of the city’s border with the mainland, which has been largely closed by pandemic restrictions

title: Solar power opponents prevail in Williamsport, Ohio
description: EDF Renewables is abandoning plans for a 400-megawatt photovoltaic array in response to intense local opposition.

title: Killer dubbed 'The Serpent' arrives in France from Nepal
description: Confessed serial killer Charles Sobhraj has arrived in France after being released from a life sentence in a Nepal prison

title: Georgia special grand jury wraps up probe of Trump, allies
description: A special grand jury investigating whether then-President Donald Trump and his allies illegally tried to overturn his defeat in the 2020 election in Georgia appears to be wrapping up its work, but many questions remain

title: Record number of migrants crossed southern border: CBP
description: There was a record number of migrants that crossed southern border last month, according to CBP data.

title: Mall of America lifts lockdown after reported shooting
description: The Mall of America in Minnesota was under lockdown in the midst of a reported shooting.

title: Trump attacks Jan. 6 report, claiming it produced no evidence
description: Former President Trump responded publicly Friday night to the final report released by the House Jan. 6 committee, attacking the committee and refuting its findings.

title: Flight canceled? Experts share some advice about what to do
description: Thousands of travelers have been stranded at airports or stuck on hold trying to rebook flights this week as a massive storm snarled travel in the U.S. and Canada ahead of the holidays

title: Newsom grants 10 pardons, including for drug crimes
description: California Gov. Gavin Newsom has granted 10 pardons, including for several people convicted of drug crimes more than 20 years ago and a man facing the possibility of deportation

title: NYC robbery crews drug unsuspecting men, some fatally
description: Multiple people have been fatally poisoned with narcotics in New York City in what investigators say are schemes by criminal crews to incapacitate and rob people at bars and nightclubs
